Class SubroutineDanger

  • java.lang.Object
    • SubroutineDanger

  • public class SubroutineDanger
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class SubroutineDanger. It calculates df, ffm, adfm, grass, timber, fload and bui indices.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SubroutineDanger(double dry, double wet, boolean isnow, double precip, double wind, double buo, int iherb)
      Instantiates a new subroutine danger.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Adjust bui by adding the drying factor.
      void adjustFFMForHerb(double iherb)
      Adjusts fine fuel moisture for herb state.

      Calculates the drying factor.
      void setADFM()
      Sets the adjusted fuel moisture index.
      void setBuildUpIndex(double precip)
      Sets the builds up index where buo is yesterday's buildup The bui is adjusted for precipitation before adding the drying factor
      void setFineFuelMoisture(double dry, double wet)
      Sets the fine fuel moisture index.
      void setFload()
      Sets the fire load index.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubroutineDanger

        public SubroutineDanger(double dry,
                        double wet,
                        boolean isnow,
                        double precip,
                        double wind,
                        double buo,
                        int iherb)
        Instantiates a new subroutine danger.
        Parameters:
        dry - the dry bulb temperature
        wet - the wet bulb temperature
        isnow - some positive non zero number if there is snow on the ground
        precip - the precipitation factor
        wind - the current windspeed in miles per hour
        buo - the last value of the build up index
        iherb - the current herb state of the district 1=cured, 2=transition, 3=green

    • Method Detail

      • setBuildUpIndex

        public void setBuildUpIndex(double precip)
        Sets the builds up index where buo is yesterday's buildup The bui is adjusted for precipitation before adding the drying factor
        Parameters:
        precip - is the past 24 hours precipitation in inches and hundredths

      • setFineFuelMoisture

        public void setFineFuelMoisture(double dry,
                                double wet)
        Sets the fine fuel moisture index. The depression of the wet bulb is used to decide which set of A and B indicators will be used
        Parameters:
        dry - is the dry bulb temperature
        wet - is the wet bulb temperature

      • calculateDryingFactor

        public void calculateDryingFactor()
        Calculates the drying factor. The drying factor indicator is added to the fine fuel moisture index.

      • adjustFFMForHerb

        public void adjustFFMForHerb(double iherb)
        Adjusts fine fuel moisture for herb state.
        Parameters:
        iherb - the herb state is used to adjust the calculated ffm by adding 5 percent for transition stage.

      • adjustBUIByDryingFactor

        public void adjustBUIByDryingFactor()
        Adjust bui by adding the drying factor. After correction for rain, the drying factor is added to obtain the current buildup index

      • setADFM

        public void setADFM()
        Sets the adjusted fuel moisture index. ffm is the current fine fuel moisture, bui is today's buildup index recovery and e is the base of natural logs.

      • setGrassTimber

        public void setGrassTimber(double wind)
        Sets the grass and timber indices. If both fuel moistures are greater than 30 percent, the timber and grass spread indices are set to 1. Two formulas are necessary to calculate grass and timber indices according to windspeed.
        Parameters:
        wind - Test to see if windspeed is greater than 14 mph.

      • setFload

        public void setFload()
        Sets the fire load index. It is necessary that neither timber nor buildup spread indices be zero If either timber or buildup spread indices are zero, fire load index is zero.
